settings.title: ABOUT BANDA BAGS
settings.text: Banda Bags is a 100% cruelty-free, sustainable and artisanal accessories collection. We are committed to providing our talented global community of artists with more economic opportunities, employment and a fair wage.¬†¬†Known for our fresh bold colors and intricate embroidered details, our brand offers a myriad of silhouettes to complement any wardrobe.

settings.title: Banda Bags: Where Fashion-Minded Meets Mindful
settings.content: If you share our love for fashion as well as empowering women and communities; if you want to pay tribute to culture and heritage and carry a unique item, you‚Äôve come to the right place!

settings.title: How are Banda Bags produced?
settings.answer:
Banda Bags are uniquely handcrafted using a combination of hand-embroidery and paddle wheel sewing. We pride ourselves on these techniques as they maintain the integrity of a traditional art form in Indonesia in addition to the abstinence of mass-factory production. Mass-factory production not only lacks character in the creation, but in certain countries it has been the source of environmental irresponsibility as well as human right's abuse.

Please be advised that given the handcrafted nature of our collections, along with the remote location and access to materials, there may be subtle differences in each Banda Bag...but again, we believe that makes Banda Bags even more special and unique!

settings.title: Why are Banda Bags Vegan/Cruelty-Free?
settings.answer: Animal-free fabrics have a smaller carbon footprint than materials (such as leather) requiring factory farming - a practice that often results in the increase of environmental devastation. As well as being "greener" than leather, vegan materials also spare animals castration, branding, tail-docking and other practices deemed cruel. Banda Bags is committed to maintaining a smaller carbon footprint as well as keeping animals safe!

settings.title: What is the size difference between the Weekender Bag and the Mini Weekender Bag?
settings.answer:
¬∑¬†The Weekender Bag dimensions are:¬†20 in Long x 10 in Wide x 13 in High /¬†50 cm L x 25 cm W x 33 cm H.

¬∑¬†The Mini Weekender Bag dimensions are:¬†15.5 in Long x 9¬†in Wide x 9.5¬†in High / 39.5¬†cm L x 23 cm W x 24¬†cm.

But unless you have a ruler in your hands, this might not mean diddly to you. So here's how we differentiate:

¬∑ The Weekender Bag will fit several outfits and toiletries for a weekend getaway! It also is the exact maximum size approved for carry-on baggage on a plane.

¬∑ The Mini Weekender Bag will fit a change of small clothes for your barre or yoga class. Or, if you are like to carry a big everyday bag to fit your iPad, makeup case, etc. this bag will satisfy your needs.

Check some videos here.

settings.title: How do I care for my Banda Bag?
settings.answer: If you receive any stain or mark on your bag, simply dampen a cloth and lightly rub the area as to take care of the fine embroidery.

settings.title: Do I have to pay duty/taxes for shipping?
settings.answer: Generally speaking, NO. The amount of a Banda Bags purchase is usually lower than the minimum taxable amount. However, each duty/tax situation is unique to the country's customs laws. In the case that customs requires duty/taxes to be paid, it is the responsibility of the customer. If a customer refuses to pay duties and the item is returned, the return shipping fee will be deducted from the purchase.¬†

settings.title: How long is the delivery time?
settings.answer: Delivery time vary from 3 to 8 business days depending on your location.

settings.title: Return & Exchanges
settings.answer:
In the rare event that you do not want your Banda Bag, we accept returns and exchanges. Please email¬†bandababes@bandabags.com¬†to arrange.

Please note that returns or exchanges must be made within 7 days of purchase. A $5 restocking fee will be deducted from your purchase refund amount. Exchanges can be made and the restocking fee will be omitted.¬†

Please Note ~ If you received free shipping we will need to charge for shipping .

Please Note ~ the Refund, Exchange and Cancellation times written above are not valuable as we are unable to change them ~ Refund and Exchanges: Please Contact us within 7 days of delivery / Ship item back within 7 days of delivery / Request a cancellation within 4 hours or purchase.

Please contact us and we will give you a return shipping address üíó

Please use reused or recycled packaging when shipping back to us ! We don't need it to look nice we prefer to keep the earth nice¬†

You can use any old box or old envelope .. and we take responsibility for any risk or damage to the item so no need to add bubble wrap üôèüåéü•∞

Your happiness means a lot to us so don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us with any problem you have and we will happily support ! :)

settings.title: Are you a retailer?
settings.answer: Please contact us¬†for wholesale¬†opportunities. We are confident¬†that your customers will be happy to see Banda Bags in your beautiful store.

settings.title: The Most Unique Bags. Ever
settings.text: This is our head turning guarantee. Shop bold colors and designs to compliment your style.

settings.html1: If you share our love for fashion as well as empowering women and communities; if you want to pay tribute to culture and heritage and carry a unique item, you‚Äôve come to the right place! Our story begins in 2015 in Sumatra. Here we began our work of not only reviving a dying art of traditional embroidery, but we married it with fresh, modern designs. The result? The stunning, ethically-fashionable bag collection called Banda Bags was born.
settings.html2: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XCPeMgwXq9Y" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

settings.html1: When women are empowered, communities thrive! We support girls who want to learn a trade...women who don‚Äôt want to settle for an arranged marriage...moms who want to be able to work from home‚Ä¶retirees who don‚Äôt want to labor outdoors anymore‚Ä¶aspiring fashion designers who want to showcase their talent to the world.

In today‚Äôs fashionable world, fast and cheap seems to dominate. But have you considered the people who make the bags? What do you think they earn if you are paying so little for an item? That is not the narrative here at Banda Bags. Everyone deserves the right for fair pay, fair trade and fair labor practices.

We feel it is our duty to leave the lightest footprint possible. We are committed to sourcing more sustainable materials in our production process. Currently we use a recycled nylon (RPET) material for the outer material. Our goal is to use waste-plastic thread for the embroidery with organic cotton, hemp or canvas for the interior lining.

‚ÄúThis is Gita, our youngest artisan, yet don‚Äôt let her age fool you, she is incredibly talented! She has been watching her grandma sew since a child and fashion runs in her blood. She is helping design bags while also lending herself to the embroidery aspect.‚Äù

‚ÄúMeeting with the team at Rini, one of our artisan‚Äôs, home. Here we discussed the future of production, increasing the purchase of sewing machines and offering more training programs for women.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis is one of the bubbliest artisans working for Banda Bags! Almitra is always a joy to be around, she is full of so much light and positivity. She was a victim of the 2004 tsunami and lost many family members. Despite the tragedies in her life, she inspires us to live a life a happiness regardless of circumstances.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis is Putri. She joined Banda Bags in 2016. She has fine-tuned her craft and has been putting away money for her future wedding, which traditionally her family is supposed to pay for, but they could not afford. Fortunately, she is now able to have the wedding of her dreams!.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis is Banda Bags. A group of hard-working women who want to have a better future for themselves and their family! 
We pride ourselves on creating a work atmosphere that allows flexibility to raise your children and be able to make an income at the same time!.‚Äù

‚ÄúMeet Rini! She is one of our head producers. She helps to manage a group of 10 artisans. She started out just as embroidery specialist, but has since become the head of operations for the training program. She is as beautiful as she is talented!.‚Äù
All of these women have a story . All of these women want to live a better life. We all deserve that right. it is my mission to support these wonderful women and your support helps!
settings.title3: Hear from our artisans how Banda Bags has affected their lives.
settings.html2: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/t1miWEkL8hk" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

settings.title: Meet our Artisans
settings.text: We employ more than 80 artisans. They are young women, mothers, grandmas, retirees...EMPOWERMENT FOR ALL

settings.title: Check out our reviews
settings.subheading: Want to hear from our clients aka banda babes?
settings.text: We appreciate any comments or feedback to help us improve or a pat on the back to keep us motivated!

settings.title: 50% OFF SAMPLE SALE!
settings.text: These bags are made by our artisans-in-training and use different materials than out standard collection

settings.title: FREE PYRAMID
settings.text: When you spend $300+

settings.sub_title:
Hello beautiful souls!
My name is Brianna.
settings.rich_content: I am the ‚Äúboss lady‚Äù of Banda Bags. I am so happy to share our story with you. In 2011 I came to Sumatra and fell in love with the wild, natural beauty and exotic culture that was so foreign to my soul. One day, I stumbled upon some artisans selling these incredibly stunning handbags. I purchased a few to bring back home (never knowing this purchase would change mine and the artisans‚Äô lives in the future!) People would walk across the street to stop me and inquire about my gorgeous bag. They are seriously head-turning!¬† Overtime it dawned on me that these bags needed to be shared with the world. But what I eventually found out that was even more important was that going back and building this brand meant helping empower and support women while reviving a dying, traditional embroidery. In 2015, I moved to Sumatra permanently and since then I‚Äôll admit its been quite a journey for an American woman living in a very remote, devout Muslim region and running a business!
settings.rich_content_1:
But I am so proud of how far we have come. What started with only a few artisans has now expanded across the province and we have a training program to help teach women of all ages a new trade so that they can make their own money and be empowered to make their own choices for their life - no more prearranged marriages under my watch! Sadly, that is the fate of many women in this part of the world, and in fact, worldwide. When women don‚Äôt have an education or opportunity in life they are left without much options and sometimes are quite literally sold off by family. I am so grateful for the freedom and privileges I have been given so it is my mission to help other women gain that privilege, too. By lending your support to Banda Bags you are also joining that mission.

So I thank you from the bottom of my heart. It means the world to me and these beautiful women!
settings.welcome_text:
Welcome to our
Banda Bags Community!

settings.Embed_Video: <iframe width="100%" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XCPeMgwXq9Y" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
settings.Embed_Videos: <iframe width="100%" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/t1miWEkL8hk" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

settings.testimonial_description: ‚ÄúThank you @bandabags I‚Äôm in love with my bag! I also have my red travel bag I get so many compliments on!‚Äù
‚ÄúI am so excited to go away for a few days and just unwind. I packed all my things in this gorgeous @bandabags. It is so cute, lightweight and practical.‚Äù
‚ÄúBags may not change the world, but the women who carry them will. @bandabags is an ethical and vegan fashion company that supports women, families, culture & the environment‚Äù

settings.testimonial_title: What people are saying about Banda Bags?

settings.testimonial_description: When women are empowered, communities thrive! We support girls who want to learn a trade...women who don‚Äôt want to settle for an arranged marriage...moms who want to be able to work from home‚Ä¶retirees who don‚Äôt want to labor outdoors anymore‚Ä¶aspiring fashion designers who want to showcase their talent to the world.

We feel it is our duty to leave the lightest footprint possible. We are committed to sourcing more sustainable materials in our production process. Currently we use a recycled nylon (RPET) material for the outer material. Our goal is to use waste-plastic thread for the embroidery with organic cotton, hemp or canvas for the interior lining.

In today‚Äôs fashionable world, fast and cheap seems to dominate. But have you considered the people who make the bags? What do you think they earn if you are paying so little for an item? That is not the narrative here at Banda Bags. Everyone deserves the right for fair pay, fair trade and fair labor practices.

Our bags are handcrafted with extremely lightweight materials, much lighter than leather, yet hold the same durability due to their intricate embroidery. This is one of the reasons Banda Bags are the perfect travel bags.
All of these women want to live a better life. We all deserve that right. It is my mission to support these wonderful women and your support helps!
